lev.debug

Class LLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • lev.debug.LLogger

  • public class LLogger
extends java.lang.Object
    A debug log package that offers several locations and options for outputting debug information.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LLogger(java.lang.String debugPath) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addSpecial(java.lang.Enum key, java.lang.String filePath)
      Adds a special log tied to the Enum key, that can be exported to by using that key.
      void close()
      Closes all associated Debug files.
      void flush()
      Forces all logs to export their buffers.

      Logs to the asynchronous log.

      Logs an error message on both to the sync log and to the main overview log.

      • LLogger

        public LLogger(java.lang.String debugPath)
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • addSpecial

        public void addSpecial(java.lang.Enum key,
              java.lang.String filePath)
        Adds a special log tied to the Enum key, that can be exported to by using that key.
        Parameters:
        key - Key to add the special log under
        filePath - Path to give the special log.

      • logSync

        public void logSync(java.lang.String header,
           java.lang.String... log)
        A function that will log messages to the synchronized log if the syncing flag is on. Otherwise, it will output to the asynchronized log.
        Parameters:
        header -
        log -

      • newSyncLog

        public void newSyncLog(java.lang.String filePath)
        Creates a new sync log in the desired location.
        Parameters:
        filePath -

      • sync

        public void sync(boolean on)
        Turn the synchronized logging on/off. If this is on, all logSync() output will go to the synchronized log; if off, the messages will go to the asynchronous log instead.
        Parameters:
        on -

      • sync

        public boolean sync()
        Returns:
        Whether the LLogger is current output to the sync log.
